name: Old Fashioned
preparation: In an Old Fashioned glass, combine sugar syrup and bitters. Add an ice cube, pour in whiskey, and gently stir. Garnish with orange peel.
flavorDescription: Dry, spirit-forward, with balanced sweetness, bitterness, and subtle citrus notes.
personalImpression: A timeless minimalist classic that fully exposes the quality of the whiskey.

name: Mojito
preparation: Gently muddle mint with sugar syrup and lime juice. Fill the glass with crushed ice, add rum, top with soda water, and stir lightly.
flavorDescription: Bright, citrusy, herbal, and extremely refreshing.
personalImpression: Effortless summer drink — refreshing, light, and slightly deceptive.

name: Negroni
preparation: Add all liquid ingredients to a glass over ice, stir until chilled, and garnish with orange peel.
personalImpression: Sharp personality drink — polarizing, but unforgettable once acquired.

name: Chianti
preparation: Serve slightly below room temperature. Decant or allow to breathe for 15–30 minutes before drinking.
flavorDescription: Dry, high acidity, with notes of sour cherry, red berries, herbs, and subtle earthiness.
personalImpression: Honest, food-driven wine — shines best alongside Italian cuisine.

name: Laurent-Perrier Champagne
preparation: Chill to serving temperature. Open carefully without shaking and pour gently into a flute.
flavorDescription: Fresh and elegant, with citrus, white flowers, fine bubbles, and mineral notes.
personalImpression: Restrained luxury — celebratory without being loud.
